description: From Middle English encombren, from Old French encombrer, from en- + combrer (“to hinder”); see cumber.

verbs.description: encumber (third-person singular simple present encumbers, present participle encumbering, simple past and past participle encumbered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To load down something with a burden.
(transitive) To restrict or block something with a hindrance or impediment.
(transitive) To burden with a legal claim or other obligation.
